State-by-State Voter Data Access Guide

This comprehensive guide provides information on how to obtain voter registration lists and voter history data across all 50 U.S. states. Use the table below for a quick comparison, or browse by category to find states that match your needs and budget.

Categories by Access and Cost

‚úÖ Tested & Verified

These states have been independently tested and confirmed working:

Ohio Free North Carolina Free Pennsylvania $20 Florida Free Georgia $485 Washington Free

Why These Are Great: Confirmed processes, known timelines, verified to work. Start here for reliable access.

üéâ Free & Unrestricted Access

No cost, minimal barriers, available to anyone:

Ohio North Carolina Florida Mississippi Vermont Washington New York

Best Features:

  • Ohio: Instant FTP download
  • North Carolina: Weekly updates, 10 years of history
  • Washington: Email link in minutes

üí∞ Extremely Low Cost ($0-$50)

Minimal investment for comprehensive data:

Arkansas $2.50 Idaho $20 Alaska $20 Pennsylvania $20 Michigan $23-$50 Delaware $25 Rhode Island $25 Missouri ~$35 Minnesota $46

Standouts:

  • Arkansas: Champion at $2.50
  • Pennsylvania: 40 elections of voter history for $20
  • Michigan: FOIA request, flash drive or FTP delivery

üîì Free/Low Cost with Eligibility Requirements

Great value if you meet the criteria:

Oklahoma Free* Virginia ~$57* Minnesota $46*

Requirements:

  • Oklahoma: Must be OK resident or candidate/party/PAC
  • Virginia: Candidate, party, or PAC ($9.50 per million records)
  • Minnesota: Must be registered MN voter

üíµ Moderate Cost ($100-$500)

Reasonable pricing for most campaigns and organizations:

California $100 Colorado $100 Maryland $125 Wyoming $125 Kansas $200 South Dakota $225 Connecticut $300 New Jersey ~$375 Georgia $485 Nebraska $500 Oregon $500 Illinois $500 Arizona ~$516 West Virginia $500-$1K

Best Values:

  • South Dakota: Reduced from $2,500 to $225 in 2025
  • Nebraska: $500 with one year of free monthly updates
  • Maryland: 10 elections of history included

üí∏ Higher Cost ($1,000-$5,000)

Significant investment required:

Montana $1,000 Utah $1,050 Texas ~$1,279 Iowa $1,500 Maine $2,200 South Carolina $2,500 Tennessee $2,500 Kentucky $4,000 Louisiana $5,000 Indiana $5,000 New Mexico ~$5,200

Notes:

  • Louisiana: $0.01/voter with $5,000 cap
  • Indiana: Annual subscription, restricted access
  • South Carolina: Must be SC registered voter

üö´ Very High Cost or Complex ($5,000+)

Prohibitively expensive or extremely difficult:

New Hampshire $8,300 Wisconsin ~$12,500 Nevada ~$20,000 Alabama ~$37,000 Massachusetts Impractical Hawaii Complex

Special Challenges:

  • Alabama: $0.01 per voter with no cap = ~$37,000 statewide
  • Nevada: $0.01 per name = ~$20,000 statewide
  • Massachusetts: No statewide list; must contact 351 municipalities individually
  • Hawaii: Must contact all 4 counties separately
  • Wisconsin: ‚ÄúBadger Voters‚Äù portal at ~$12,500

Key Insights

üèÜ Best Overall Value

  1. Arkansas ($2.50) - Unbeatable price
  2. Ohio (Free) - Instant download
  3. North Carolina (Free) - Weekly updates, 10-year history
  4. Pennsylvania ($20) - 40 elections of history
  5. Michigan ($23-$50) - FOIA efficiency

üìä Best Voter History Coverage

  • Pennsylvania: 40 elections
  • Illinois: 15 elections
  • North Carolina: 10 years
  • Maryland: 10 elections
  • Kentucky: 5 years

‚ö° Fastest Access

  • Ohio: Instant FTP download
  • Washington: Email link in minutes
  • North Carolina: Immediate download

üîÑ Best Update Programs

  • Nebraska: $500 with one year of free monthly updates
  • North Carolina: Weekly updates (free)
  • Mississippi: Weekly email updates (free)
  • Rhode Island: 3 free updates included ($25)

‚ö†Ô∏è States to Avoid (Unless Necessary)

  • Massachusetts: No statewide system
  • Alabama: ~$37,000 cost
  • Nevada: ~$20,000 cost
  • Wisconsin: ~$12,500 cost

Getting Started

For Researchers & Small Organizations

Start with these free/low-cost states:

  • Ohio, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Arkansas, Idaho, Michigan, Missouri

For Statewide Campaigns

Budget-friendly options with good coverage:

  • Georgia ($485), Nebraska ($500), Oregon ($500), Connecticut ($300)

For National Projects

Focus on:

  1. Free states first (7 states)
  2. Under-$50 states (9 states)
  3. Moderate-cost states as budget allows
  4. Avoid Massachusetts, Alabama, Nevada, Wisconsin unless essential

  • Main Blog - Full list of state guides

  • NCSL Voter Registration Lists - Legal framework information

Last Updated: November 2025

Note: Costs and processes may change. Always verify current information with state election officials before purchasing.
